intro: Erigeron laxiflorus, commonly known as the slender fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas such as fields and roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, while its flowers are usually white or pale blue, appearing in late summer to early autumn. Erigeron laxiflorus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
